intro: Chilita humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt's chilita, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
